meanings.definition: To cut (something) into a desired shape or design.
meanings.sent1: She carefully carved a heart into the tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: The artist carved a beautiful sculpture out of wood.
meanings.sent3: The kids carved their names into the sand at the beach.
meanings.sent4: His words were carved into her heart forever.
meanings.sent5: The ancient symbols were intricately carved into the stone walls.

meanings.definition: To create or produce (something) by cutting into a surface.
meanings.sent1: He carved a boat out of a piece of driftwood.
meanings.sent2: The chef carved a stunning ice sculpture for the event.
meanings.sent3: She playfully carved a smiley face into the pumpkin.
meanings.sent4: The memories of that day were deeply carved into his mind.
meanings.sent5: The initials were elegantly carved into the wedding cake.

meanings.definition: To decorate or embellish by cutting into a surface.
meanings.sent1: The intricate patterns were carved onto the wooden frame.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler carved delicate designs into the silver bracelet.
meanings.sent3: He carved a funny face into the apple to surprise his friend.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter carved a path through the silence of the room.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight carved patterns of light and shadow on the floor.
